item.title: ECE720
item.description: In this course, we investigate dependability attributes including performance, reliability, availability, fault tolerance, security, maintainability and operation of distributed systems. We study these topics from the analytical modeling point of view. Provided that, related theories including stochastic processes, queuing theory, petri nets and machine learning algorithms will be employed to quantify dependability measures of interest. As a result, students will learn how to apply their learning in designing dependable distributed computing systems.

item.title: EECS 5XXX
item.description:
Coming Soon.
This is an introductory course in Distributed Systems. Distributed systems is the study of how to build a computer system where the state of the program is divided over more than one machine (or “node”).
